name: 陳協慶
objective: The purpose of this course is to train students to familiarize themselves with the statistical methods and theories that are often used. They can use collected data to analyze unknown phenomena and lay the foundation for other related disciplines. Course content includes sampling theory, point estimation, statistical inference, hypothesis testing, regression analysis, analysis of variance, and nonparametric tests.
schedule:
(wk1) Sampling and Sampling Distribution (normal & chi-square)
(wk2) Sampling and Sampling Distribution (t & F distribution)
(wk3) Point Estimation
(wk4) Confidence interval of mean and variance
(wk5) Quiz#1
(wk6,7,8) Hypotheses Tests
(wk9) Midterm Exam
(wk10) Comparison Multiple Proportions, Test of Independence and Goodness of Fit
(wk11,12) Experimental Design and ANOVA
(wk13) Quiz#2
(wk14) Simple Linear Regression
(wk15) Multiple Regression
(wk16,17) Nonparametric Tests
(wk18) Final
materials: Statistics for Business & Economics, by Anderson, et al.
